channel.title: [AllStar]HELP[/Allstar]
channel.description:
I need a webclient tutorial that will work for All-Star Base. I followed Rics Tut and got these errors... (AFTER IT DOWNLOADS CACHE)
It gives me these errors [img]http://neroscape.com/clientupdated.jpg[/img]
And then this one, counting down from 60 [img]http://neroscape.com/retryin.jpg[/img]
**NOTE** Like I said, this is AFTER it downloads the cache I have posted something simular but before it DID NOT DOWNLOAD THE CACHE FIRST
[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,516693.msg3751658.html#msg3751658]Click Here to view[/url]
I really need someones help on this, I REALLY NEED A WEBCLIENT TUT MADE FOR ALLSTAR But if you don't know where I could find that, at least help me out here:\
Thanks, FILLOST

item.title: [AllStar]HELP[/Allstar]
item.dc:creator: @Aciid Aciid
item.description:
@Aciid wrote:

i might be able to take a look at it…
the cache isnt downloading… you need to open up your
cachedownloader.java , signlink.java , and class36.java, also maybe the sprites.java , and make sure you edit all of the “./”
to “C:/” and make sure you change all of the previous cache name to your cache name like so
From:
“runescapecache”
To:
“yourcache”

also make sure you are editing everything the right way…
make sure you read above and check the methods before you change anything…
Just a tip xD

Read full topic

item.title: [AllStar]HELP[/Allstar]
item.dc:creator: @Fillost Fillost
item.description:
@Fillost wrote:

Tested that, found out that this part was messed up

I used to have this, in my client.java

Then I fixed it to this

NOTE
I changed the second cache.zip to neroscape_cache.zip

And now, it downloads the cache EXTREMELY fast, but it doesn’t show it in my C:\ directory…

And once it’s done downloading the cache it gives me this error

Any Idea of what’s wrong?:\

You can test for yourself by Clicking Here

I am not advertising! If anybody has any problems with this post I will edit it back to MYCLIENT…
BUMP

Read full topic

item.title: [AllStar]HELP[/Allstar]
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

The Allstar client isn’t much different from Bluurs clients. If it’s loading on the page like this you got the hard part done (Signing the stuff to search in a different file). Check how you packed the cache and make sure all your directories are correct.

Read full topic
